alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 1:20PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Navajo County near Cedar Springs. * WHEN...Until 315 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Hazardous travel on dirt roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 119 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavier rainfall had ended, however impacts from earlier rainfall likely. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Jeddito Wash, Ha-whi-yalin Wash, Coyote Wash and Tees Toh Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tees Toh and Cedar Springs. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
